resources.string:
SAN JERÓNIMO TRAVEL 
 Apps mobile devices 
 University of Antioquia 
 Developed by: Gerson Cárdenas

The Quimbaya Hotel is a Country Resort located at San Jerónimo Antioquia. A place of great natural exuberance and tropical climate. An excellent choice to satisfy your needs for rest, recreation, conventions and meetings.\n Direction: El Rincón countryside. Km 1, San Jerónimo, Antioquia \n Phone number: (4) 2684915

El Tesoro Hotel and Convention Center is ideal for a family getaway,the natural surroundings, tranquility and all amenities you need to feel the guest more pampered and enjoy an excellent stay.\n Direction: road to Santa Fé de Antioquia, San Jerónimo, Antioquia \n Phone number: (4) 8582054

Dharma Hotel Boutique Spa, a hotel for your senses. We offer a wide range of services to meet the least of your desires. Come and live an unforgettable experience in the best hotel at San Jeronimo.\n Direction: 1 mile, old road towards Sopetrán, San Jerónimo, Antioquia \n Phone number: (4) 8581779 / 3205127705

Route 62, Bar and Grills. 
 Excellent attention.
 Direction: Route 62, San Jerónimo, Antioquia 
 Phone number: 311 5205958

Disco Bar Tonunu, the best Crossover place of San Jerónimo, where we have the best prices on local and imported liquors. Excellent attention.\n Direction: Avenue 11 # 23 - 00, San Jerónimo, Antioquia \n Phone number: (4) 8580331
Nuestra Señora de La Candelaria Church

Located in San Jerónimo, near the exit of the West tunnel, this park offers an excellent alternative for fun, wetlands, children, family and semi-Olympic swimming pool; sports courts, four spectacular waterslides, lazy river rides, self-service, gym, reading room, internet and a large auditorium for 350 people are always available for the enjoyment of visitors and businesses.
 Direction: San Jerónimo, Km 32 - 33 road to the sea 
 Phone number: 57(4) 858 04 75
 Website: www.comfenalcoantioquia.com

Near the city center only 30 minutes walking is The Guaracú creek, whose waters flow down from the top of the ridge and dramatically get close passing through San Jerónimo forming what is known in the region as "Las Angusturas" and consist in narrow channels that the creek has carved its way through the rocks.

The church is a neoclassical style, was built between 1864-1895, is rectangular, its interior is divided into three naves, the lateral walls are made of mud, its main facade is built in solid bricks glued with mortar and where stands the bulrush with three openings for the bells.

Welcome to the town of San Jeronimo, West of Antioquia, Sun and Fruits route, connected to the city of Medellin by one of the greatest engineering works in Colombia such as the Tunnel of the West Fernando Gomez Martinez, 35 minutes from Medellin.

 Country: Colombia
 State: Antioquia
 Region: SouthWest
 Location: 35 km west of Medellín
 Population: 11.627 citizens 
 Demonym: Jeronimitas, San Jeronimeños
 Website: http://www.sanjeronimo-antioquia.gov.co/
